evidence.text: On February 12, 2025, the Court issued a temporary restraining order.  The order directed that Mr. Dellinger “shall continue to serve as the Special Counsel” until the Court rules on his application for a preliminary injunction.

extracted.value: On February 12, 2025, the Court issued a temporary restraining order (TRO) in response to the plaintiff’s motion, thereby granting the TRO.

evidence.text: For these reasons, defendants’ motion to stay pending appeal [Dkt. # 36] is DENIED.

extracted.value: The Court denied defendants’ motion to stay pending appeal.

evidence.text: In consideration of all of these circumstances, then, the Court finds, pursuant to Rule 65(b)(2), that there is good cause to extend the temporary restraining order for an additional three days, through Saturday, March 1, so that the status quo will be preserved for the brief period of time it takes to complete the written opinion on the consolidated motion for preliminary injunction and cross motions for summary judgment.

extracted.value: The Court extended the temporary restraining order for an additional three days through Saturday, March 1, 2025.
